dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HRES 769 IH: Affirming the State of Palestine’s right to exist.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Green of Texas submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: Affirming the State of Palestine’s right to exist.

whereas.text: Whereas this resolution may be cited as the Original Resolution Affirming the State of Palestine’s Right to Exist;
Whereas Palestinian people are inhabitants of the land of Palestine;
Whereas, in 1947, the United Nations General Assembly passed Resolution 181, which called for the partition of Palestine into Arab and Jewish States;
Whereas, on May 14, 1948, President Harry Truman issued a statement recognizing Israel as an independent State; and

Whereas, on November 28, 2023, the House of Representatives agreed to House Resolution 888, Reaffirming the State of Israel’s right to exist, by a vote of 412 Yeas, one Nay, and one Present: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: affirms Palestine’s right to exist and at a future time to become a nation State;
recognizes the two-state solution as the only solution that will secure a lasting peace in the region; and
